title.narrative: ProBiCo Grants, Subsidies, and Contributions

description.narrative: ProBiCo Covers grants (including revenue- sharing), subsidies, gratuities, and other aid for which cash payments are made to states, other political subdivisions, corporations, associations, and individuals; contributions to international societies, commissions, proceedings, or projects, whether in lump sum or as quotas of expenses; contributions fixed by treaty; grants to foreign countries; taxes imposed by taxing authorities where the Federal Government has consented to taxation (excluding the employers share of Federal Insurance Contribution Act taxes); and payments in lieu of taxes. Includes readjustment and other benefits for veterans, other than indemnities for death or disability.

Nonproliferation, Anti-Terrorism, Demining and Related Programs
Nonproliferation, Anti-Terrorism, Demining and Related Programs

title.narrative: ande Ko' Project

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to strengthen Paraguays capacity to prevent and process cases of trafficking in persons and to provide protection for victims. The project will target departments and stakeholders in the capital city. The implementer will train network stakeholders on the identification of trafficking victims and victim service provision. The project anticipates holding trainings for participants from the public and private sector and conducting awareness raising events. The implementer will develop comprehensive training manuals for victim care providers and, with the participation of representatives from state institutions and civil society organizations, develop a referral mechanism among victim service providers and government stakeholders. The project will also create a directory of victim care institutions for local networks and stakeholders.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of State: Nonproliferation Assistance Programs - Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund

description.narrative: Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund - Unspecified Enforcement/Interdiction: National Security Interest; The Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund (NDF) provides a means for the USG to respond rapidly to high priority nonproliferation and disarmament opportunities, circumstances, or conditions that are unanticipated or unusually difficult. NDF projects aim to destroy, secure, or prevent the proliferation of WMD, WMD-related materials and delivery systems, and destabilizing conventional weapons.

sector.narrative: Rule of Law and Human Rights

title.narrative: Documentation of Yshir Cultural Traditions in the Paraguayan Pantanal

description.narrative: Once a hunter-gatherer culture dependent upon the freshwater wetland region shared by Paraguay, Bolivia, and Brazil, the Yshir are quickly losing their traditional life-ways and distinct language. This project involves the documentation and dissemination of traditional cultural knowledge of local natural resources and capacity building in cultural preservation.

participating-org.narrative: Union for Yshir Nation Indigenous Communities

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

receiver-org.narrative: Union for Yshir Nation Indigenous Communities
